sn52.4:4.1: At one time Venerables Anuruddha, Sāriputta, and Mahāmoggallāna were staying near Sāketa, in the Thorny Wood.
sn52.4:4.2: Then in the late afternoon, Sāriputta and Mahāmoggallāna came out of solitude, went to Anuruddha,
sn52.4:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side.
sn52.4:4.6: “Reverend Anuruddha, what things should a trainee mendicant enter and remain in?”
sn52.4:5.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, a trainee mendicant should enter and remain in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn52.4:5.3: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn52.4:5.4: They meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn52.4:5.6: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn52.4:5.7: A trainee mendicant should enter and remain in these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
